plainFields.name: expires_at
plainFields.description: Expiry time after which the reset token is invalid.

plainFields.name: completed_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the password reset completed successfully. Null until completed.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Creation timestamp of the reset artifact.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Last update timestamp of the reset artifact.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Soft deletion timestamp used when artifacts are removed prior to natural expiry for policy reasons.

models.name: todoapp_user_list_preferences
models.description: Per-account list behavior preferences controlling how todo lists are presented by default. Each account has at most one row. This model is read frequently alongside user-owned items to determine page size, default sorting, and default filter scope. Enforces a 1:1 relationship with {@link todoapp_accounts}. No derived values are stored; only raw preference settings with temporal fields for auditability.

foreignFields.name: todoapp_account_id
foreignFields.description: Owner account's {@link todoapp_accounts.id}. Enforces 1:1 per account for list preferences.

plainFields.name: page_size
plainFields.description: Default list page size used for pagination. Supported values by business policy: 10, 20, 50, or 100 items per page.

plainFields.name: default_sort
plainFields.description: Default sorting key for lists. Allowed business values: "due_date_asc", "due_date_desc", "created_at_desc", "updated_at_desc", or "title_asc".

plainFields.name: default_status_filter
plainFields.description: Default status filter applied to lists. Allowed business values: "non_trashed" (default view), "open", "completed", or "trashed".

plainFields.name: default_due_window
plainFields.description: Optional default due-date window applied to lists. Business values: "none", "today", "tomorrow", "this_week", "next_week", "overdue", or "no_due_date".

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Creation timestamp.

plainFields.name: updated_at

plainFields.name: deleted_at

models.name: todoapp_user_display_preferences
models.description: Per-account display preferences defining presentation behavior such as theme, density, locale, and date/time formats. Each account has at most one row. Enforces a 1:1 relationship with {@link todoapp_accounts}. These settings influence UI rendering but contain no computed values. Temporal fields support audit and lifecycle handling.

foreignFields.name: todoapp_account_id
foreignFields.description: Owner account's {@link todoapp_accounts.id}. Enforces 1:1 per account for display preferences.

plainFields.name: theme
plainFields.description: Preferred theme. Business-allowed values include: "light", "dark", or "system".

plainFields.name: density
plainFields.description: Preferred UI density. Business-allowed values include: "comfortable" or "compact".

plainFields.name: locale
plainFields.description: Preferred locale identifier for UI texts (e.g., "en-US"). May be left null to use service default.

plainFields.name: date_format
plainFields.description: Preferred date format pattern (e.g., "YYYY-MM-DD"). Business rules may validate accepted patterns in application layer.

plainFields.name: time_format_24h
plainFields.description: Whether to use 24-hour time format (true) or 12-hour format (false).

plainFields.name: first_day_of_week
plainFields.description: Preferred first day of week for calendar views as ISO numeric value (1=Monday ... 7=Sunday).

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Creation timestamp.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Last update timestamp.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Soft deletion timestamp for preference record, if any.

models.name: todoapp_device_labels
models.description: User-defined labels for devices used in session listings. Each row belongs to an account and represents a logical device identified by a stable device_key within that account. A single device label may be associated with many {@link todoapp_sessions} through the sessions-side foreign key (1 label → many sessions). Composite uniqueness on (todoapp_account_id, device_key) prevents duplicates. Includes timestamps for lifecycle and last-used tracking.

foreignFields.name: todoapp_account_id
foreignFields.description: Owner account's {@link todoapp_accounts.id}. Establishes 1:N relationship (an account can have multiple device labels).

plainFields.name: device_key
plainFields.description: Stable, hashed device identifier within the account scope. Used to group sessions for the same physical/logical device. Must be unique per account.

plainFields.name: label
plainFields.description: User-provided device label for identification in session listings (e.g., "Home Laptop", "Work Phone").

plainFields.name: last_used_at
plainFields.description: Optional timestamp reflecting when this device was last seen in activity; managed by application logic.

plainFields.name: created_at

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Last update timestamp.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Soft deletion timestamp for this label record, if any.

models.name: todoapp_todo_items
models.description: User-owned todo items with core fields and temporal markers. Ownership is enforced via the {@link todoapp_users} relationship. State is represented by raw fields (completed_at, deleted_at) to avoid transitive dependencies; applications derive status (open/completed/trashed) from these fields. Purge scheduling uses purge_after_at for retention policies. Related historical changes are captured in {@link todoapp_todo_item_events}.

foreignFields.name: todoapp_user_id
foreignFields.description: Owner user's {@link todoapp_users.id}.

plainFields.name: title
plainFields.description: Required short text identifying the item. Trimmed length 1–120 characters; no control characters.

plainFields.name: description
plainFields.description: Optional extended text describing the task. Trimmed length up to business limit.

plainFields.name: due_date
plainFields.description: Optional due date/time. For date-only semantics, store end-of-day in the user’s time zone and mark due_date_is_date_only=true.

plainFields.name: due_date_is_date_only
plainFields.description: Whether the provided due date is a date-only value (interpreted as end-of-day in the user’s time zone).

plainFields.name: completed_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the item was marked completed. Null if not completed or reopened.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Soft-delete timestamp indicating the item is in trash. Null when active.

plainFields.name: purge_after_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp after which a trashed item becomes eligible for permanent purge per retention policy.

plainFields.name: version
plainFields.description: Monotonic version for optimistic concurrency control on updates.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Creation timestamp.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Last update timestamp.

models.name: todoapp_todo_item_events
models.description: Immutable, append-only event log for {@link todoapp_todo_items}. Each record captures the event context (actor, optional bulk operation) and a post-change snapshot of key item fields for historical accuracy. Supports audit needs and temporal analysis without denormalizing live item data.

foreignFields.name: todoapp_todo_item_id
foreignFields.description: Related item’s {@link todoapp_todo_items.id}.

foreignFields.name: actor_todoapp_user_id
foreignFields.description: Actor end-user’s {@link todoapp_users.id} when the event was triggered by a user.

foreignFields.name: actor_todoapp_admin_id
foreignFields.description: Actor admin’s {@link todoapp_admins.id} when the event was triggered by an administrator.

foreignFields.name: todoapp_bulk_operation_id
foreignFields.description: Originating bulk operation’s {@link todoapp_bulk_operations.id} if this event was part of a bulk action.

plainFields.name: event_type
plainFields.description: Event type. Expected values include: created, updated, completed, reopened, trashed, restored, purged, and policy_removed.

plainFields.name: reason
plainFields.description: Optional human-readable reason or justification for the event (e.g., admin moderation).

plainFields.name: note
plainFields.description: Optional additional context or short comment associated with the event.

plainFields.name: post_title
plainFields.description: Snapshot: item title immediately after the event was applied.

plainFields.name: post_description
plainFields.description: Snapshot: item description immediately after the event was applied.

plainFields.name: post_due_date
plainFields.description: Snapshot: item due date/time immediately after the event (end-of-day if date-only).

plainFields.name: post_due_date_is_date_only
plainFields.description: Snapshot: whether the due date was represented as date-only after the event.

plainFields.name: post_completed_at
plainFields.description: Snapshot: completion timestamp after the event, if completed.

plainFields.name: post_deleted_at
plainFields.description: Snapshot: soft-delete timestamp after the event, if trashed.

plainFields.name: post_purge_after_at
plainFields.description: Snapshot: purge eligibility timestamp after the event, if applicable.

plainFields.name: occurred_at
plainFields.description: Business event occurrence time (when the action happened).

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Record creation timestamp (ingestion time).

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Record update timestamp (generally unchanged after insertion).

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Optional soft-delete timestamp for removing an event from active views (rarely used; retained for consistency).

models.name: todoapp_bulk_operations
models.description: Bulk operation executions affecting multiple {@link todoapp_todo_items}. Tracks initiator (user or admin), the operation type and selection criteria, execution status, timings, and outcome counters. Individual item changes generated by a bulk run are recorded as {@link todoapp_todo_item_events} referencing this operation.

foreignFields.name: initiator_todoapp_user_id
foreignFields.description: Initiating end-user’s {@link todoapp_users.id} when the bulk action was started by a user.

foreignFields.name: initiator_todoapp_admin_id
foreignFields.description: Initiating admin’s {@link todoapp_admins.id} when the bulk action was started by an administrator.

plainFields.name: operation_type
plainFields.description: Type of bulk operation. Expected values include: complete, reopen, trash, restore, purge.

plainFields.name: criteria
plainFields.description: Human-readable or serialized criteria describing the selection (e.g., status=open AND due window=this_week).

plainFields.name: status
plainFields.description: Execution status: pending, running, succeeded, failed, or cancelled.

plainFields.name: total_count
plainFields.description: Total number of targeted items at the start of the bulk operation.

plainFields.name: success_count
plainFields.description: Number of items successfully processed by the bulk operation.

plainFields.name: failure_count
plainFields.description: Number of items that failed during processing.

plainFields.name: started_at
plainFields.description: Start timestamp for the bulk operation execution.

plainFields.name: finished_at
plainFields.description: Completion timestamp for the bulk operation execution.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Record creation timestamp.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Record update timestamp.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Optional soft-delete timestamp for the bulk operation record.

models.name: todoapp_export_requests
models.description: Represents a user-controlled data export request. Each record belongs to an owning account {@link todoapp_accounts} and may optionally be initiated by an administrator {@link todoapp_admins} for lawful requests. Tracks business intent (status and options) and anchors related {@link todoapp_export_jobs} and {@link todoapp_export_artifacts}. Designed for strict privacy, auditability, and asynchronous processing without coupling to core todo tables.

foreignFields.name: todoapp_account_id
foreignFields.description: Owning account's {@link todoapp_accounts.id}.

foreignFields.name: requested_by_admin_id
foreignFields.description: Optional initiating administrator's {@link todoapp_admins.id} when the export is triggered by an admin on behalf of a user.

plainFields.name: code
plainFields.description: Business identifier for the export request used in communications or deep links (not a secret token). Should be unique service-wide.

plainFields.name: status
plainFields.description: Current lifecycle status of the export request. Expected values include: pending, queued, processing, completed, failed, canceled.

plainFields.name: include_trashed
plainFields.description: Whether to include items currently in trash within the export scope.

plainFields.name: requested_by_role
plainFields.description: Actor role at initiation time for auditing (e.g., user, admin).

plainFields.name: note
plainFields.description: Optional requester-provided note or reason for the export. Useful for audit trails.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Creation timestamp of the export request.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Last update timestamp of the export request.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Soft deletion timestamp. When set, the request is logically deleted.

models.name: todoapp_export_jobs
models.description: Asynchronous processing attempts for an export request {@link todoapp_export_requests}. Multiple jobs may exist per request to support retries or reprocessing. Stores operational lifecycle data (queue/attempts, timings, statuses) without duplicating request or account data to maintain 3NF. Enforces uniqueness of attempt numbers per request.

foreignFields.name: todoapp_export_request_id
foreignFields.description: Associated export request's {@link todoapp_export_requests.id}.

plainFields.name: status
plainFields.description: Job execution status. Expected values include: queued, running, completed, failed, canceled.

plainFields.name: attempt
plainFields.description: Monotonic attempt number for this request (e.g., 1 for first run, 2 for first retry). Must be unique per request.

plainFields.name: priority
plainFields.description: Optional priority indicator for scheduling (higher = more urgent).

plainFields.name: queued_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the job was enqueued.

plainFields.name: started_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when processing actually began.

plainFields.name: finished_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when processing ended (success or failure).

plainFields.name: error_code
plainFields.description: Short machine-friendly code for failure categorization, if any.

plainFields.name: error_message
plainFields.description: Human-readable error message for diagnostics, if any.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Creation timestamp of the job record.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Last update timestamp of the job record.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Soft deletion timestamp. When set, the job is logically deleted.

models.name: todoapp_export_artifacts
models.description: Immutable outputs produced by export processing. Each artifact belongs to an export request {@link todoapp_export_requests} and may reference the producing job {@link todoapp_export_jobs}. Contains delivery metadata such as storage location, content type, filename, size, checksum, and retention/expiry for privacy-by-design. Optimized for latest-artifact retrieval via request and ready time.

foreignFields.name: todoapp_export_request_id
foreignFields.description: Parent export request's {@link todoapp_export_requests.id}.

foreignFields.name: todoapp_export_job_id
foreignFields.description: Producing job's {@link todoapp_export_jobs.id}. Optional when artifacts are attached after initial job completion.

plainFields.name: storage_uri
plainFields.description: Canonical storage URI where the artifact is persisted (e.g., object storage).

plainFields.name: content_type
plainFields.description: MIME type of the artifact content (e.g., application/json, text/csv).

plainFields.name: filename
plainFields.description: Original or suggested filename for download purposes.

plainFields.name: size_bytes
plainFields.description: Total size of the artifact in bytes.

plainFields.name: checksum
plainFields.description: Checksum (e.g., SHA-256) for integrity verification.

plainFields.name: ready_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the artifact became available for download.

plainFields.name: expires_at
plainFields.description: Optional expiry timestamp after which the artifact should be considered unavailable and eligible for purge.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Creation timestamp of the artifact record.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Last update timestamp of the artifact record.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Soft deletion timestamp. When set, the artifact is logically deleted (revoked).

models.name: todoapp_audit_logs
models.description: System-wide audit trail for business and security-relevant events. Records actor context (account/session), subject hints, and outcome. Relations are configured to preserve audit history if referenced entities are removed by setting onDelete=SetNull for optional foreign keys. Supports investigations and compliance reporting.

foreignFields.name: todoapp_account_id
foreignFields.description: Actor account that triggered the event. {@link todoapp_accounts.id}

foreignFields.name: todoapp_session_id
foreignFields.description: Associated session for the event when available. {@link todoapp_sessions.id}

foreignFields.name: todoapp_todo_item_id
foreignFields.description: Subject todo item when the event pertains to a specific item. {@link todoapp_todo_items.id}

plainFields.name: event_type
plainFields.description: Categorical event type (e.g., login.success, todo.create, admin.session.revoke).

plainFields.name: severity
plainFields.description: Severity label (e.g., info, warning, high).

plainFields.name: outcome
plainFields.description: Outcome classification (e.g., success, failure, denied).

plainFields.name: message
plainFields.description: Optional human-readable message or summary suitable for search and review.

plainFields.name: ip
plainFields.description: Origin IP address captured at the time of the event when available.

plainFields.name: user_agent
plainFields.description: Client user agent captured at the time of the event when available.

plainFields.name: subject_model
plainFields.description: Name of the subject entity/table involved (e.g., todoapp_todo_items, todoapp_accounts) for generic correlation.

plainFields.name: subject_id
plainFields.description: Identifier of the subject entity when a concrete resource was affected; not a foreign key by design.

plainFields.name: occurred_at
plainFields.description: UTC timestamp when the business event occurred (immutable).

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Record creation timestamp (storage time).

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Record last update timestamp (metadata maintenance only).

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Soft deletion timestamp for retention control; null when active.

models.name: todoapp_admin_action_logs
models.description: Audit records for elevated administrator actions that impact user accounts, sessions, or content. Links to acting admin and explicit access justification. Required relations use onDelete=Restrict to protect history; optional target references use onDelete=SetNull so logs persist when targets are removed.

foreignFields.name: todoapp_admin_id
foreignFields.description: Acting administrator responsible for this action. {@link todoapp_admins.id}

foreignFields.name: todoapp_access_justification_id
foreignFields.description: Justification entry documenting the business reason for elevated access/action. {@link todoapp_access_justifications.id}

foreignFields.name: todoapp_account_id
foreignFields.description: Target account affected by this action when applicable. {@link todoapp_accounts.id}

foreignFields.name: todoapp_user_id
foreignFields.description: Target user affected by this action when applicable. {@link todoapp_users.id}

foreignFields.name: todoapp_todo_item_id
foreignFields.description: Target todo item affected by this action when applicable. {@link todoapp_todo_items.id}

plainFields.name: action_type
plainFields.description: Categorical name of the administrative action (e.g., session.revoke, account.suspend, content.remove).

plainFields.name: scope
plainFields.description: Optional scope or context string (e.g., policy namespace, feature area, or case identifier).

plainFields.name: outcome
plainFields.description: Outcome of the action (e.g., success, failure, partial).

plainFields.name: reason_text
plainFields.description: Free-form explanation complementing the structured justification when provided.

plainFields.name: ticket_reference
plainFields.description: External case/ticket identifier associated with the action, when present.

plainFields.name: occurred_at
plainFields.description: UTC timestamp when the administrative action occurred (immutable).

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Record creation timestamp (storage time).

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Record last update timestamp (metadata maintenance only).

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Soft deletion timestamp for retention control; null when active.

models.name: todoapp_access_justifications
models.description: Catalog of access and action justification reasons used to authorize elevated administrative operations. Includes unique code, human-readable name, optional description/policy reference, and activation flag. Provenance link to the admin curator is optional and uses onDelete=SetNull to preserve catalog entries if the admin is removed.

foreignFields.name: todoapp_admin_id
foreignFields.description: Administrator who created or last curated this justification entry (when tracked). {@link todoapp_admins.id}

plainFields.name: code
plainFields.description: Unique business code for the justification (e.g., POL-USER-VERIFY).

plainFields.name: name
plainFields.description: Human-readable name/title for the justification.

plainFields.name: description
plainFields.description: Detailed description of when this justification applies and any constraints.

plainFields.name: policy_reference_uri
plainFields.description: Optional URI to internal policy documentation for this justification.

plainFields.name: active
plainFields.description: Whether this justification is currently active and selectable for new admin actions.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Record creation timestamp.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Record last update timestamp.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Soft deletion timestamp for retention control; null when active.

models.name: todoapp_legal_holds
models.description: Records policy or legal holds that prevent purge or alteration of user resources. A hold can be scoped to an entire account and/or to a specific todo item. While active, retention and purge processes must defer deletion of the affected records. Designed for auditability with explicit imposed and release timestamps. Related entities: {@link todoapp_accounts} and {@link todoapp_todo_items}.

foreignFields.name: todoapp_account_id
foreignFields.description: Account under hold, referencing {@link todoapp_accounts.id}.

foreignFields.name: todoapp_todo_item_id
foreignFields.description: Specific todo item under hold, referencing {@link todoapp_todo_items.id}.

plainFields.name: active
plainFields.description: Whether the hold is currently effective. Applications should ensure exactly one active record per scope when required by policy.

plainFields.name: reason_code
plainFields.description: Short machine-friendly code describing why the hold exists (e.g., legal_dispute, compliance_investigation).

plainFields.name: note
plainFields.description: Optional human-readable explanation or additional context for the hold.

plainFields.name: reference_uri
plainFields.description: Optional link to a policy document, case file, or external reference associated with this hold.

plainFields.name: imposed_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the hold was imposed. Used for audit and precedence.

plainFields.name: released_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the hold was released, if applicable. Null means still active until explicitly released.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Record creation time for auditability.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Last update time for auditability.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Soft deletion time, if the record is logically removed from active use.

models.name: todoapp_account_deletions
models.description: Lifecycle controller for account deletions including request time, scheduled deletion after grace, and eventual completion or cancellation. Enforces least-privilege oversight by optionally linking to an admin actor. Timestamps represent business state transitions without storing derived status fields. Related entities: {@link todoapp_accounts} (required), optional {@link todoapp_admins}.

foreignFields.name: todoapp_account_id
foreignFields.description: Target account scheduled for deletion. {@link todoapp_accounts.id}.

foreignFields.name: todoapp_admin_id
foreignFields.description: Admin who initiated or confirmed the deletion, if applicable. {@link todoapp_admins.id}.

plainFields.name: requested_at
plainFields.description: When the deletion was requested.

plainFields.name: scheduled_deletion_at
plainFields.description: When the account is scheduled to be permanently deleted after the grace period.

plainFields.name: canceled_at
plainFields.description: If the deletion was canceled during the grace period, the time of cancellation.

plainFields.name: completed_at
plainFields.description: When the permanent deletion completed, if applicable.

plainFields.name: deletion_grace_days
plainFields.description: Grace window in days captured at the time of the request for audit (e.g., 14).

plainFields.name: initiated_by_admin
plainFields.description: Whether the deletion request was initiated by an administrator (true) or by the user (false).

plainFields.name: requested_reason
plainFields.description: Optional free-text reason supplied at request time (user-provided or administrative note).

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Record creation time for auditability.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Last update time for auditability.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Soft deletion time, if the record is logically removed from active use.

models.name: todoapp_purge_queue_items
models.description: Work queue entries for policy-driven permanent deletion of eligible records across domains. Uses a generic target_table and target_id to support heterogeneous resources under compliance governance. Includes scheduling, prioritization, locking, retry metadata, and outcome information to ensure reliable purge orchestration.

plainFields.name: target_table
plainFields.description: Exact table name containing the record to purge (e.g., todoapp_todo_items, todoapp_export_artifacts).

plainFields.name: target_id
plainFields.description: Primary key value of the target record to purge within target_table.

plainFields.name: eligible_at
plainFields.description: When this record becomes eligible for purge (e.g., end of retention or grace).

plainFields.name: priority
plainFields.description: Relative processing priority; lower numbers may be treated as higher priority depending on worker policy.

plainFields.name: attempts
plainFields.description: Number of processing attempts performed so far for this queue item.

plainFields.name: last_attempt_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp of the last processing attempt, if any.

plainFields.name: locked_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when a worker locked this item for processing.

plainFields.name: locked_by
plainFields.description: Identifier for the worker/node that acquired the lock.

plainFields.name: processed_at
plainFields.description: When the item finished processing (success or terminal failure).

plainFields.name: success
plainFields.description: Whether the purge operation ultimately succeeded. Null until processing completes.

plainFields.name: error_code
plainFields.description: Optional short code describing the last failure reason, if any.

plainFields.name: error_message
plainFields.description: Optional detailed error message for diagnostics; avoid sensitive data.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Record creation time for auditability.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Last update time for auditability.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Soft deletion time, if the queue entry is logically removed from active use.

models.name: todoapp_account_suspensions
models.description: Account-level suspension records for policy enforcement and recovery. Links to the affected account, optionally to the initiating admin and the access justification. Stores immutable reason, start time, optional review schedule, and lift time. No denormalized active flag; activity is inferred by whether {@link todoapp_account_suspensions.lifted_at} is null. Supports investigative queries and auditability alongside {@link todoapp_admin_action_logs} and {@link todoapp_access_justifications}.

foreignFields.name: todoapp_account_id
foreignFields.description: Affected account's {@link todoapp_accounts.id}.

foreignFields.name: initiated_by_admin_id
foreignFields.description: Initiating administrator's {@link todoapp_admins.id}. Nullable for system-initiated suspensions or automated policy actions.

foreignFields.name: access_justification_id
foreignFields.description: Business justification record's {@link todoapp_access_justifications.id} documenting why the action was taken.

plainFields.name: reason
plainFields.description: Human-readable reason for suspension (policy code, case link, or narrative summary).

plainFields.name: suspended_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the suspension took effect.

plainFields.name: review_at
plainFields.description: Optional timestamp suggesting when to review the suspension for continuation or lift.

plainFields.name: lifted_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the suspension was lifted. Null if still in effect.

plainFields.name: suspension_type
plainFields.description: Categorization of suspension scope (e.g., write-only, full). Free-form string for policy evolution; not an enum at DB level.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Creation timestamp for this record.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Last update timestamp for this record.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Soft deletion timestamp; null means active.

models.name: todoapp_rate_limit_incidents
models.description: Signals and records of rate limit incidents for abuse detection, user guidance, and tuning. Optionally associates with an account and session if known, while allowing anonymous actors via IP attribution. Captures action category, observed counts versus threshold, and whether the action was blocked. Complements monitoring and audit without storing sensitive secrets.

foreignFields.name: todoapp_account_id
foreignFields.description: Associated account's {@link todoapp_accounts.id}, if the actor is authenticated.

foreignFields.name: todoapp_session_id
foreignFields.description: Associated session's {@link todoapp_sessions.id}, if available.

plainFields.name: action
plainFields.description: Normalized action/category identifier at business level (e.g., write, read, login, export).

plainFields.name: window_start
plainFields.description: Start time of the rolling window used by the limiter when evaluating this incident.

plainFields.name: window_end
plainFields.description: End time of the rolling window used by the limiter when evaluating this incident.

plainFields.name: observed_count
plainFields.description: Number of actions observed within the window.

plainFields.name: limit_threshold
plainFields.description: Allowed maximum actions for the evaluated window at the time of the incident.

plainFields.name: blocked
plainFields.description: Whether the limiter blocked the action(s) at the time of this incident.

plainFields.name: ip
plainFields.description: Actor source IP in textual form (IPv4/IPv6). May be empty if unavailable or redacted by policy.

plainFields.name: user_agent
plainFields.description: User-Agent string captured for investigative purposes. May be truncated per policy.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Creation timestamp for this record.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Last update timestamp for this record.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Soft deletion timestamp; null means active.

models.name: todoapp_security_events
models.description: General security event ledger capturing notable occurrences (e.g., authentication successes/failures, session revocations, admin support actions). Stores immutable event type, severity, occurrence time, optional actor/target context, and brief message for investigation. Links to accounts, sessions, admins, and access justifications where applicable. Complements {@link todoapp_audit_logs} while focusing on security signals and detection needs.

foreignFields.name: todoapp_account_id
foreignFields.description: Associated account's {@link todoapp_accounts.id}, if any.

foreignFields.name: todoapp_session_id
foreignFields.description: Associated session's {@link todoapp_sessions.id}, if any.

foreignFields.name: todoapp_admin_id
foreignFields.description: Associated administrator's {@link todoapp_admins.id}, when the actor is an admin.

foreignFields.name: access_justification_id
foreignFields.description: Access justification's {@link todoapp_access_justifications.id} for privileged actions requiring documented reason.

plainFields.name: event_type
plainFields.description: Business-level event type key (e.g., auth.login.success, auth.login.failure, session.revoked, admin.support.view).

plainFields.name: severity
plainFields.description: Event severity classification (e.g., low, medium, high, critical). Free-form string for policy evolution.

plainFields.name: occurred_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the underlying event actually occurred (may differ from record creation time).

plainFields.name: source_ip
plainFields.description: Source IP address (IPv4/IPv6 textual). May be null if unavailable or redacted by policy.

plainFields.name: user_agent
plainFields.description: User-Agent string for investigative context. May be truncated per policy.

plainFields.name: target_resource_id
plainFields.description: Optional UUID of the resource involved (generic target; not a foreign key to maintain independence).

plainFields.name: message
plainFields.description: Short human-readable message or context snippet without sensitive secrets.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Creation timestamp for this record.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Last update timestamp for this record.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Soft deletion timestamp; null means active.

nodeModules.node_modules/.prisma/client/index.d.ts:
/**
 * Client
**/

import * as runtime from './runtime/library.js';
import $Types = runtime.Types // general types
import $Public = runtime.Types.Public
import $Utils = runtime.Types.Utils
import $Extensions = runtime.Types.Extensions
import $Result = runtime.Types.Result

export type PrismaPromise<T> = $Public.PrismaPromise<T>


/**
 * Model todoapp_service_settings
 * Platform-wide service settings scoped by deployment environment. Defines
 * global operational defaults such as time zone, token/session lifetimes,
 * rate limits, retention windows, and other guardrails used across
 * services. Configuration is read by application services; no direct FK
 * dependencies to business tables to avoid circular coupling.
 * 
 * @namespace Systematic
 * @author AutoBE - https://github.com/wrtnlabs/autobe
 */
export type todoapp_service_settings = $Result.DefaultSelection<Prisma.$todoapp_service_settingsPayload>
/**
 * Model todoapp_password_policies
 * Password policy catalog defining enforcement parameters for
 * authentication. Policies include minimum length, character class
 * requirements, banned password list version, and reuse-prevention window.
 * Application logic selects an active policy by name; no direct FK
 * dependencies to user entities.
 * 
 * @namespace Systematic
 * @author AutoBE - https://github.com/wrtnlabs/autobe
 */
export type todoapp_password_policies = $Result.DefaultSelection<Prisma.$todoapp_password_policiesPayload>
/**
 * Model todoapp_maintenance_windows
 * Planned maintenance or read-only windows scoped per environment. Supports
 * one-off or recurring schedules via a string RRULE. Used by operations to
 * communicate downtime and by services to apply protective modes.
 * Status-based retrieval is common during operations dashboards.
 * 
 * @namespace Systematic
 * @author AutoBE - https://github.com/wrtnlabs/autobe
 */
export type todoapp_maintenance_windows = $Result.DefaultSelection<Prisma.$todoapp_maintenance_windowsPayload>
/**
 * Model todoapp_feature_flags
 * Environment-scoped feature toggles controlling conditional behavior
 * across services. Flags include on/off state, optional progressive
 * rollout, and optional targeting rules serialized as string. Read-heavy
 * usage patterns require fast retrieval of enabled flags per environment.
 * 
 * @namespace Systematic
 * @author AutoBE - https://github.com/wrtnlabs/autobe
 */
export type todoapp_feature_flags = $Result.DefaultSelection<Prisma.$todoapp_feature_flagsPayload>
/**
 * Model todoapp_accounts
 * Primary account entity representing a unique identity within todoApp.
 * Stores authentication credential artifacts (hashed password), email
 * address, and verification state. Acts as the anchor for role assignments
 * via {@link todoapp_users} and {@link todoapp_admins}, for sessions via
 * {@link todoapp_sessions}, and for short-lived artifacts in {@link
 * todoapp_email_verifications} and {@link todoapp_password_resets}. Follows
 * least-privilege principles by keeping profile and preference data outside
 * of this table.
 * 
 * @namespace Actors
 * @author AutoBE - https://github.com/wrtnlabs/autobe
 */
export type todoapp_accounts = $Result.DefaultSelection<Prisma.$todoapp_accountsPayload>
/**
 * Model todoapp_users
 * Role assignment table for standard end users. Represents the "user" role
 * bound 1:1 to an {@link todoapp_accounts} record. Keeps role membership
 * separate from credentials for least-privilege and clear authorization
 * boundaries.
 * 
 * @namespace Actors
 * @author AutoBE - https://github.com/wrtnlabs/autobe
 */
export type todoapp_users = $Result.DefaultSelection<Prisma.$todoapp_usersPayload>
/**
 * Model todoapp_admins
 * Role assignment table for administrative users operating under
 * least‑privilege with audit. Represents the "admin" role bound 1:1 to an
 * {@link todoapp_accounts} record. Separation from credentials and user
 * content enables strict access governance and auditing.
 * 
 * @namespace Actors
 * @author AutoBE - https://github.com/wrtnlabs/autobe
 */
export type todoapp_admins = $Result.DefaultSelection<Prisma.$todoapp_adminsPayload>
/**
 * Model todoapp_user_profiles
 * End-user profile and personalization data separated from credentials.
 * Bound 1:1 with {@link todoapp_accounts}. Stores display preferences such
 * as display name, locale, and time zone. Used by application layers to
 * render dates in the user’s local time while keeping authentication data
 * isolated.
 * 
 * @namespace Actors

### `todoapp_service_settings`

Platform-wide service settings scoped by deployment environment. Defines
global operational defaults such as time zone, token/session lifetimes,
rate limits, retention windows, and other guardrails used across
services. Configuration is read by application services; no direct FK
dependencies to business tables to avoid circular coupling.

Properties as follows:

- `id`: Primary Key.
- `environment`
  > Deployment environment identifier (e.g., development, staging,
  > production). Used to scope settings uniquely per environment.
- `default_time_zone`
  > Default IANA time zone used when a user profile has no preference.
  > Example: Asia/Seoul.
- `session_max_concurrent`
  > Maximum number of concurrently active sessions per user account (business
  > default: 10).
- `access_token_ttl_minutes`: Access token validity duration in minutes (business default: 20).
- `refresh_token_ttl_days`: Refresh token validity duration in days (business default: 30).
- `session_inactivity_ttl_days`: Days of inactivity after which a session expires (business default: 30).
- `reauth_required_minutes`
  > Minutes defining the recent re-authentication window required for
  > sensitive actions (business default: 15).
- `email_verification_token_ttl_hours`: Email verification token validity in hours (business default: 24).
- `password_reset_token_ttl_minutes`: Password reset token validity in minutes (business default: 60).
- `login_failure_threshold`
  > Number of failed login attempts allowed within the policy window before
  > cooldown applies (business default: 10).
- `login_cooldown_minutes`
  > Cooldown duration in minutes after exceeding login failure threshold
  > (business default: 5).
- `write_ops_per_minute`
  > Per-account write operations per minute allowed before throttling
  > (business default: 60).
- `read_ops_per_minute`
  > Per-account read operations per minute allowed before throttling
  > (business default: 120).
- `bulk_action_item_limit`
  > Maximum number of items permitted in a single interactive bulk operation
  > (business default: 50).
- `trash_retention_days`
  > Number of days items remain in soft-deleted state before automatic purge
  > (business default: 30).
- `account_deletion_grace_days`
  > Grace period in days before permanent account deletion after
  > user-initiated request (business default: 14).
- `unverified_account_purge_days`
  > Number of days after which unverified accounts are purged if not verified
  > (business default: 14).
- `export_sla_hours`
  > Target hours within which user data exports should be made available
  > under normal conditions (business default: 24).
- `created_at`: Record creation timestamp.
- `updated_at`: Record last update timestamp.
- `deleted_at`: Soft deletion timestamp. Null when active.

### `todoapp_password_policies`

Password policy catalog defining enforcement parameters for
authentication. Policies include minimum length, character class
requirements, banned password list version, and reuse-prevention window.
Application logic selects an active policy by name; no direct FK
dependencies to user entities.

Properties as follows:

- `id`: Primary Key.
- `name`
  > Unique policy name used by applications to reference this password policy
  > (e.g., default, strict_2025).
- `min_length`: Minimum allowed password length.
- `require_uppercase`: Whether at least one uppercase character is required.
- `require_lowercase`: Whether at least one lowercase character is required.
- `require_numbers`: Whether at least one numeric digit is required.
- `require_special`: Whether at least one special character is required.
- `banned_passwords_version`
  > Identifier of the banned/compromised password list revision used for
  > checks (e.g., top10k-2025-01).
- `prevent_last_n_reuse`: Number of most recent passwords disallowed for reuse.
- `description`: Human-readable description of this policy and its intended usage context.
- `created_at`: Record creation timestamp.
- `updated_at`: Record last update timestamp.
- `deleted_at`: Soft deletion timestamp. Null when active.

### `todoapp_maintenance_windows`

Planned maintenance or read-only windows scoped per environment. Supports
one-off or recurring schedules via a string RRULE. Used by operations to
communicate downtime and by services to apply protective modes.
Status-based retrieval is common during operations dashboards.

Properties as follows:

- `id`: Primary Key.
- `environment`
  > Deployment environment this maintenance applies to (e.g., staging,
  > production).
- `code`
  > Business identifier code for the maintenance window; unique within the
  > same environment.
- `title`: Short, searchable title of the maintenance window.
- `description`: Detailed description of scope, impact, and guidance.
- `starts_at`: Scheduled start timestamp (UTC).
- `ends_at`: Scheduled end timestamp (UTC).
- `recurring`: Whether the maintenance window recurs on a schedule.
- `recurrence_rule`
  > Recurrence rule (e.g., RRULE) when recurring=true; stored as string for
  > portability.
- `status`
  > Lifecycle status label (e.g., scheduled, in_progress, completed,
  > canceled).
- `created_at`: Record creation timestamp.
- `updated_at`: Record last update timestamp.
- `deleted_at`: Soft deletion timestamp. Null when active.

### `todoapp_feature_flags`

Environment-scoped feature toggles controlling conditional behavior
across services. Flags include on/off state, optional progressive
rollout, and optional targeting rules serialized as string. Read-heavy
usage patterns require fast retrieval of enabled flags per environment.

Properties as follows:

- `id`: Primary Key.
- `environment`: Deployment environment this flag applies to (e.g., staging, production).
- `key`
  > Feature flag key (programmatic identifier). Unique within the same
  > environment.
- `description`: Human-readable description of the flag’s purpose and scope.
- `enabled`: Whether the feature is globally enabled for this environment.
- `rollout_percentage`
  > Progressive rollout percentage (0–100) for gradual enablement;
  > applications interpret this according to targeting strategy.
- `targeting_rules`
  > Optional serialized targeting criteria (e.g., JSON or DSL) for
  > audience-based rollout. Stored as string for portability.
- `created_at`: Record creation timestamp.
- `updated_at`: Record last update timestamp.
- `deleted_at`: Soft deletion timestamp. Null when active.

### `todoapp_accounts`

Primary account entity representing a unique identity within todoApp.
Stores authentication credential artifacts (hashed password), email
address, and verification state. Acts as the anchor for role assignments
via [todoapp_users](#todoapp_users) and [todoapp_admins](#todoapp_admins), for sessions via
[todoapp_sessions](#todoapp_sessions), and for short-lived artifacts in {@link
todoapp_email_verifications} and [todoapp_password_resets](#todoapp_password_resets). Follows
least-privilege principles by keeping profile and preference data outside
of this table.

Properties as follows:

- `id`: Primary Key.
- `email`
  > Unique email address for the account. Used for authentication and
  > recovery communications. Case-insensitive uniqueness enforced by business
  > logic.
- `password_hash`
  > Argon2/bcrypt or similar password hash. Never stores raw passwords. Used
  > exclusively for credential verification.
- `email_verified`
  > Whether the account’s email has been verified. Governs access to
  > sensitive actions per policy.
- `status`
  > Business status of the account (e.g., active, suspended,
  > deletion_pending). Used for access control and lifecycle workflows.
- `last_login_at`
  > Timestamp of the most recent successful login for user-facing security
  > history and anomaly detection.
- `created_at`: Creation timestamp of the account record.
- `updated_at`: Last update timestamp of the account record.
- `deleted_at`
  > Soft deletion timestamp. When set, the account is logically deleted and
  > excluded from normal operations.

### `todoapp_users`

Role assignment table for standard end users. Represents the "user" role
bound 1:1 to an [todoapp_accounts](#todoapp_accounts) record. Keeps role membership
separate from credentials for least-privilege and clear authorization
boundaries.

Properties as follows:

- `id`: Primary Key.
- `todoapp_account_id`
  > Owning account’s [todoapp_accounts.id](#todoapp_accounts). Establishes a 1:1 mapping
  > between account and user role.
- `created_at`: Creation timestamp of the user role record.
- `updated_at`: Last update timestamp of the user role record.
- `deleted_at`: Soft deletion timestamp for role revocation without physical removal.

### `todoapp_admins`

Role assignment table for administrative users operating under
least‑privilege with audit. Represents the "admin" role bound 1:1 to an
[todoapp_accounts](#todoapp_accounts) record. Separation from credentials and user
content enables strict access governance and auditing.

Properties as follows:

- `id`: Primary Key.
- `todoapp_account_id`
  > Owning account’s [todoapp_accounts.id](#todoapp_accounts). Establishes a 1:1 mapping
  > between account and admin role.
- `created_at`: Creation timestamp of the admin role record.
- `updated_at`: Last update timestamp of the admin role record.
- `deleted_at`: Soft deletion timestamp for role revocation without physical removal.

### `todoapp_user_profiles`

End-user profile and personalization data separated from credentials.
Bound 1:1 with [todoapp_accounts](#todoapp_accounts). Stores display preferences such
as display name, locale, and time zone. Used by application layers to
render dates in the user’s local time while keeping authentication data
isolated.

Properties as follows:

- `id`: Primary Key.
- `todoapp_account_id`
  > Profile owner account’s [todoapp_accounts.id](#todoapp_accounts). Ensures exactly one
  > profile per account.
- `display_name`
  > User’s display name for UI. Does not affect authentication. Optional and
  > can be changed by the user.
- `locale`
  > Preferred locale tag (e.g., en-US). Guides language and formatting in the
  > UI.
- `time_zone`
  > IANA time zone identifier (e.g., Asia/Seoul). Used to interpret and
  > display date/time fields.
- `created_at`: Creation timestamp of the profile record.
- `updated_at`: Last update timestamp of the profile record.
- `deleted_at`: Soft deletion timestamp. When set, the profile is considered inactive.

### `todoapp_sessions`

Authentication session records bound to [todoapp_accounts](#todoapp_accounts). Enables
session listing, selective revocation, and device-level tracking in
alignment with rotating refresh-token policy. Stores only raw session
metadata (e.g., hashed refresh token); no calculated fields. Optional
link to [todoapp_device_labels](#todoapp_device_labels) for user-managed device names
(existing in another component).

Properties as follows:

- `id`: Primary Key.
- `todoapp_account_id`: Session owner account’s [todoapp_accounts.id](#todoapp_accounts).
- `todoapp_device_label_id`
  > Optional device label’s [todoapp_device_labels.id](#todoapp_device_labels) for
  > user-provided device names. Reference-only: table already exists in
  > another component.
- `device_key`
  > Stable device/session key for listing and selective revocation (e.g.,
  > fingerprint or generated key).
- `refresh_token_hash`
  > Rotating refresh token hash tied to this session. Stored as a hash;
  > unique to prevent reuse.
- `user_agent`
  > Client user-agent string captured at session creation for security
  > visibility.
- `ip`
  > Coarse IP string captured for security and session listing. Precision
  > governed by policy.
- `created_at`: Creation timestamp of the session (login time).
- `updated_at`: Last update timestamp of the session record.
- `last_activity_at`: Timestamp of the most recent activity observed for this session.
- `expires_at`: Absolute expiry time for the session or refresh token validity window.
- `revoked_at`
  > When set, indicates the session was explicitly revoked and is no longer
  > valid.
- `deleted_at`
  > Soft deletion timestamp for administrative cleanup or retention policy
  > enforcement.

### `todoapp_email_verifications`

Short-lived artifacts for email verification flows. Each record
represents a verification attempt for an [todoapp_accounts](#todoapp_accounts) email,
storing token hash and timestamps to enforce expiry and audit
requirements. Used to activate accounts or confirm email changes per
policy.

Properties as follows:

- `id`: Primary Key.
- `todoapp_account_id`
  > Target account’s [todoapp_accounts.id](#todoapp_accounts) for which email verification
  > is attempted.
- `token_hash`
  > Verification token hash. Raw tokens are never stored. Used to validate
  > verification requests.
- `sent_at`: Timestamp when the verification message was dispatched.
- `expires_at`: Expiry time after which the token is no longer valid.
- `verified_at`: Timestamp when the verification succeeded. Null until completed.
- `created_at`: Creation timestamp of the verification artifact.
- `updated_at`: Last update timestamp of the verification artifact.
- `deleted_at`
  > Soft deletion timestamp for administrative cleanup when artifacts are
  > removed before natural expiry.

### `todoapp_password_resets`

Short-lived artifacts for password reset flows scoped to {@link
todoapp_accounts}. Stores hashed tokens and lifecycle timestamps to
support secure resets, rotation, and audit without retaining sensitive
secrets.

Properties as follows:

- `id`: Primary Key.
- `todoapp_account_id`
  > Target account’s [todoapp_accounts.id](#todoapp_accounts) for which the password reset
  > is requested.
- `token_hash`
  > Password reset token hash. Raw tokens are never stored. Used to validate
  > reset requests.
- `requested_at`: Time when the password reset was requested by the user.
- `expires_at`: Expiry time after which the reset token is invalid.
- `completed_at`
  > Timestamp when the password reset completed successfully. Null until
  > completed.
- `created_at`: Creation timestamp of the reset artifact.
- `updated_at`: Last update timestamp of the reset artifact.
- `deleted_at`
  > Soft deletion timestamp used when artifacts are removed prior to natural
  > expiry for policy reasons.

  DateTime updated_at
  DateTime deleted_at "nullable"
}

  Boolean time_format_24h

}

### `todoapp_user_list_preferences`

Per-account list behavior preferences controlling how todo lists are
presented by default. Each account has at most one row. This model is
read frequently alongside user-owned items to determine page size,
default sorting, and default filter scope. Enforces a 1:1 relationship
with [todoapp_accounts](#todoapp_accounts). No derived values are stored; only raw
preference settings with temporal fields for auditability.

Properties as follows:

- `id`: Primary Key.
- `todoapp_account_id`
  > Owner account's [todoapp_accounts.id](#todoapp_accounts). Enforces 1:1 per account for
  > list preferences.
- `page_size`
  > Default list page size used for pagination. Supported values by business
  > policy: 10, 20, 50, or 100 items per page.
- `default_sort`
  > Default sorting key for lists. Allowed business values: "due_date_asc",
  > "due_date_desc", "created_at_desc", "updated_at_desc", or "title_asc".
- `default_status_filter`
  > Default status filter applied to lists. Allowed business values:
  > "non_trashed" (default view), "open", "completed", or "trashed".
- `default_due_window`
  > Optional default due-date window applied to lists. Business values:
  > "none", "today", "tomorrow", "this_week", "next_week", "overdue", or
  > "no_due_date".
- `created_at`: Creation timestamp.
- `updated_at`: Last update timestamp.
- `deleted_at`: Soft deletion timestamp for preference record, if any.

### `todoapp_user_display_preferences`

Per-account display preferences defining presentation behavior such as
theme, density, locale, and date/time formats. Each account has at most
one row. Enforces a 1:1 relationship with [todoapp_accounts](#todoapp_accounts). These
settings influence UI rendering but contain no computed values. Temporal
fields support audit and lifecycle handling.

Properties as follows:

- `id`: Primary Key.
- `todoapp_account_id`
  > Owner account's [todoapp_accounts.id](#todoapp_accounts). Enforces 1:1 per account for
  > display preferences.
- `theme`
  > Preferred theme. Business-allowed values include: "light", "dark", or
  > "system".
- `density`
  > Preferred UI density. Business-allowed values include: "comfortable" or
  > "compact".
- `locale`
  > Preferred locale identifier for UI texts (e.g., "en-US"). May be left
  > null to use service default.
- `date_format`
  > Preferred date format pattern (e.g., "YYYY-MM-DD"). Business rules may
  > validate accepted patterns in application layer.
- `time_format_24h`: Whether to use 24-hour time format (true) or 12-hour format (false).
- `first_day_of_week`
  > Preferred first day of week for calendar views as ISO numeric value
  > (1=Monday ... 7=Sunday).
- `created_at`: Creation timestamp.
- `updated_at`: Last update timestamp.
- `deleted_at`: Soft deletion timestamp for preference record, if any.

### `todoapp_device_labels`

User-defined labels for devices used in session listings. Each row
belongs to an account and represents a logical device identified by a
stable device_key within that account. A single device label may be
associated with many [todoapp_sessions](#todoapp_sessions) through the sessions-side
foreign key (1 label → many sessions). Composite uniqueness on
(todoapp_account_id, device_key) prevents duplicates. Includes timestamps
for lifecycle and last-used tracking.

Properties as follows:

- `id`: Primary Key.
- `todoapp_account_id`
  > Owner account's [todoapp_accounts.id](#todoapp_accounts). Establishes 1:N relationship
  > (an account can have multiple device labels).
- `device_key`
  > Stable, hashed device identifier within the account scope. Used to group
  > sessions for the same physical/logical device. Must be unique per
  > account.
- `label`
  > User-provided device label for identification in session listings (e.g.,
  > "Home Laptop", "Work Phone").
- `last_used_at`
  > Optional timestamp reflecting when this device was last seen in activity;
  > managed by application logic.
- `created_at`: Creation timestamp.
- `updated_at`: Last update timestamp.
- `deleted_at`: Soft deletion timestamp for this label record, if any.

"todoapp_todo_item_events" }o--|| "todoapp_todo_items" : item

### `todoapp_todo_items`

User-owned todo items with core fields and temporal markers. Ownership is
enforced via the [todoapp_users](#todoapp_users) relationship. State is represented
by raw fields (completed_at, deleted_at) to avoid transitive
dependencies; applications derive status (open/completed/trashed) from
these fields. Purge scheduling uses purge_after_at for retention
policies. Related historical changes are captured in {@link
todoapp_todo_item_events}.

Properties as follows:

- `id`: Primary Key.
- `todoapp_user_id`: Owner user's [todoapp_users.id](#todoapp_users).
- `title`
  > Required short text identifying the item. Trimmed length 1–120
  > characters; no control characters.
- `description`
  > Optional extended text describing the task. Trimmed length up to business
  > limit.
- `due_date`
  > Optional due date/time. For date-only semantics, store end-of-day in the
  > user’s time zone and mark due_date_is_date_only=true.
- `due_date_is_date_only`
  > Whether the provided due date is a date-only value (interpreted as
  > end-of-day in the user’s time zone).
- `completed_at`
  > Timestamp when the item was marked completed. Null if not completed or
  > reopened.
- `deleted_at`: Soft-delete timestamp indicating the item is in trash. Null when active.
- `purge_after_at`
  > Timestamp after which a trashed item becomes eligible for permanent purge
  > per retention policy.
- `version`: Monotonic version for optimistic concurrency control on updates.
- `created_at`: Creation timestamp.
- `updated_at`: Last update timestamp.

### `todoapp_todo_item_events`

Immutable, append-only event log for [todoapp_todo_items](#todoapp_todo_items). Each
record captures the event context (actor, optional bulk operation) and a
post-change snapshot of key item fields for historical accuracy. Supports
audit needs and temporal analysis without denormalizing live item data.

Properties as follows:

- `id`: Primary Key.
- `todoapp_todo_item_id`: Related item’s [todoapp_todo_items.id](#todoapp_todo_items).
- `actor_todoapp_user_id`
  > Actor end-user’s [todoapp_users.id](#todoapp_users) when the event was triggered by
  > a user.
- `actor_todoapp_admin_id`
  > Actor admin’s [todoapp_admins.id](#todoapp_admins) when the event was triggered by
  > an administrator.
- `todoapp_bulk_operation_id`
  > Originating bulk operation’s [todoapp_bulk_operations.id](#todoapp_bulk_operations) if this
  > event was part of a bulk action.
- `event_type`
  > Event type. Expected values include: created, updated, completed,
  > reopened, trashed, restored, purged, and policy_removed.
- `reason`
  > Optional human-readable reason or justification for the event (e.g.,
  > admin moderation).
- `note`: Optional additional context or short comment associated with the event.
- `post_title`: Snapshot: item title immediately after the event was applied.
- `post_description`: Snapshot: item description immediately after the event was applied.
- `post_due_date`
  > Snapshot: item due date/time immediately after the event (end-of-day if
  > date-only).
- `post_due_date_is_date_only`
  > Snapshot: whether the due date was represented as date-only after the
  > event.
- `post_completed_at`: Snapshot: completion timestamp after the event, if completed.
- `post_deleted_at`: Snapshot: soft-delete timestamp after the event, if trashed.
- `post_purge_after_at`: Snapshot: purge eligibility timestamp after the event, if applicable.
- `occurred_at`: Business event occurrence time (when the action happened).
- `created_at`: Record creation timestamp (ingestion time).
- `updated_at`: Record update timestamp (generally unchanged after insertion).
- `deleted_at`
  > Optional soft-delete timestamp for removing an event from active views
  > (rarely used; retained for consistency).

### `todoapp_bulk_operations`

Bulk operation executions affecting multiple [todoapp_todo_items](#todoapp_todo_items).
Tracks initiator (user or admin), the operation type and selection
criteria, execution status, timings, and outcome counters. Individual
item changes generated by a bulk run are recorded as {@link
todoapp_todo_item_events} referencing this operation.

Properties as follows:

- `id`: Primary Key.
- `initiator_todoapp_user_id`
  > Initiating end-user’s [todoapp_users.id](#todoapp_users) when the bulk action was
  > started by a user.
- `initiator_todoapp_admin_id`
  > Initiating admin’s [todoapp_admins.id](#todoapp_admins) when the bulk action was
  > started by an administrator.
- `operation_type`
  > Type of bulk operation. Expected values include: complete, reopen, trash,
  > restore, purge.
- `criteria`
  > Human-readable or serialized criteria describing the selection (e.g.,
  > status=open AND due window=this_week).
- `status`: Execution status: pending, running, succeeded, failed, or cancelled.
- `total_count`: Total number of targeted items at the start of the bulk operation.
- `success_count`: Number of items successfully processed by the bulk operation.
- `failure_count`: Number of items that failed during processing.
- `started_at`: Start timestamp for the bulk operation execution.
- `finished_at`: Completion timestamp for the bulk operation execution.
- `created_at`: Record creation timestamp.
- `updated_at`: Record update timestamp.
- `deleted_at`: Optional soft-delete timestamp for the bulk operation record.

### `todoapp_export_requests`

Represents a user-controlled data export request. Each record belongs to
an owning account [todoapp_accounts](#todoapp_accounts) and may optionally be
initiated by an administrator [todoapp_admins](#todoapp_admins) for lawful requests.
Tracks business intent (status and options) and anchors related {@link
todoapp_export_jobs} and [todoapp_export_artifacts](#todoapp_export_artifacts). Designed for
strict privacy, auditability, and asynchronous processing without
coupling to core todo tables.

Properties as follows:

- `id`: Primary Key.
- `todoapp_account_id`: Owning account's [todoapp_accounts.id](#todoapp_accounts).
- `requested_by_admin_id`
  > Optional initiating administrator's [todoapp_admins.id](#todoapp_admins) when the
  > export is triggered by an admin on behalf of a user.
- `code`
  > Business identifier for the export request used in communications or deep
  > links (not a secret token). Should be unique service-wide.
- `status`
  > Current lifecycle status of the export request. Expected values include:
  > pending, queued, processing, completed, failed, canceled.
- `include_trashed`: Whether to include items currently in trash within the export scope.
- `requested_by_role`: Actor role at initiation time for auditing (e.g., user, admin).
- `note`
  > Optional requester-provided note or reason for the export. Useful for
  > audit trails.
- `created_at`: Creation timestamp of the export request.
- `updated_at`: Last update timestamp of the export request.
- `deleted_at`: Soft deletion timestamp. When set, the request is logically deleted.

### `todoapp_export_jobs`

Asynchronous processing attempts for an export request {@link
todoapp_export_requests}. Multiple jobs may exist per request to support
retries or reprocessing. Stores operational lifecycle data
(queue/attempts, timings, statuses) without duplicating request or
account data to maintain 3NF. Enforces uniqueness of attempt numbers per
request.

Properties as follows:

- `id`: Primary Key.
- `todoapp_export_request_id`: Associated export request's [todoapp_export_requests.id](#todoapp_export_requests).
- `status`
  > Job execution status. Expected values include: queued, running,
  > completed, failed, canceled.
- `attempt`
  > Monotonic attempt number for this request (e.g., 1 for first run, 2 for
  > first retry). Must be unique per request.
- `priority`: Optional priority indicator for scheduling (higher = more urgent).
- `queued_at`: Timestamp when the job was enqueued.
- `started_at`: Timestamp when processing actually began.
- `finished_at`: Timestamp when processing ended (success or failure).
- `error_code`: Short machine-friendly code for failure categorization, if any.
- `error_message`: Human-readable error message for diagnostics, if any.
- `created_at`: Creation timestamp of the job record.
- `updated_at`: Last update timestamp of the job record.
- `deleted_at`: Soft deletion timestamp. When set, the job is logically deleted.

### `todoapp_export_artifacts`

Immutable outputs produced by export processing. Each artifact belongs to
an export request [todoapp_export_requests](#todoapp_export_requests) and may reference the
producing job [todoapp_export_jobs](#todoapp_export_jobs). Contains delivery metadata
such as storage location, content type, filename, size, checksum, and
retention/expiry for privacy-by-design. Optimized for latest-artifact
retrieval via request and ready time.

Properties as follows:

- `id`: Primary Key.
- `todoapp_export_request_id`: Parent export request's [todoapp_export_requests.id](#todoapp_export_requests).
- `todoapp_export_job_id`
  > Producing job's [todoapp_export_jobs.id](#todoapp_export_jobs). Optional when artifacts
  > are attached after initial job completion.
- `storage_uri`
  > Canonical storage URI where the artifact is persisted (e.g., object
  > storage).
- `content_type`: MIME type of the artifact content (e.g., application/json, text/csv).
- `filename`: Original or suggested filename for download purposes.
- `size_bytes`: Total size of the artifact in bytes.
- `checksum`: Checksum (e.g., SHA-256) for integrity verification.
- `ready_at`: Timestamp when the artifact became available for download.
- `expires_at`
  > Optional expiry timestamp after which the artifact should be considered
  > unavailable and eligible for purge.
- `created_at`: Creation timestamp of the artifact record.
- `updated_at`: Last update timestamp of the artifact record.
- `deleted_at`
  > Soft deletion timestamp. When set, the artifact is logically deleted
  > (revoked).

### `todoapp_audit_logs`

System-wide audit trail for business and security-relevant events.
Records actor context (account/session), subject hints, and outcome.
Relations are configured to preserve audit history if referenced entities
are removed by setting onDelete=SetNull for optional foreign keys.
Supports investigations and compliance reporting.

Properties as follows:

- `id`: Primary Key.
- `todoapp_account_id`: Actor account that triggered the event. [todoapp_accounts.id](#todoapp_accounts)
- `todoapp_session_id`
  > Associated session for the event when available. {@link
  > todoapp_sessions.id}
- `todoapp_todo_item_id`
  > Subject todo item when the event pertains to a specific item. {@link
  > todoapp_todo_items.id}
- `event_type`
  > Categorical event type (e.g., login.success, todo.create,
  > admin.session.revoke).
- `severity`: Severity label (e.g., info, warning, high).
- `outcome`: Outcome classification (e.g., success, failure, denied).
- `message`: Optional human-readable message or summary suitable for search and review.
- `ip`: Origin IP address captured at the time of the event when available.
- `user_agent`: Client user agent captured at the time of the event when available.
- `subject_model`
  > Name of the subject entity/table involved (e.g., todoapp_todo_items,
  > todoapp_accounts) for generic correlation.
- `subject_id`
  > Identifier of the subject entity when a concrete resource was affected;
  > not a foreign key by design.
- `occurred_at`: UTC timestamp when the business event occurred (immutable).
- `created_at`: Record creation timestamp (storage time).
- `updated_at`: Record last update timestamp (metadata maintenance only).
- `deleted_at`: Soft deletion timestamp for retention control; null when active.

### `todoapp_admin_action_logs`

Audit records for elevated administrator actions that impact user
accounts, sessions, or content. Links to acting admin and explicit access
justification. Required relations use onDelete=Restrict to protect
history; optional target references use onDelete=SetNull so logs persist
when targets are removed.

Properties as follows:

- `id`: Primary Key.
- `todoapp_admin_id`
  > Acting administrator responsible for this action. {@link
  > todoapp_admins.id}
- `todoapp_access_justification_id`
  > Justification entry documenting the business reason for elevated
  > access/action. [todoapp_access_justifications.id](#todoapp_access_justifications)
- `todoapp_account_id`
  > Target account affected by this action when applicable. {@link
  > todoapp_accounts.id}
- `todoapp_user_id`
  > Target user affected by this action when applicable. {@link
  > todoapp_users.id}
- `todoapp_todo_item_id`
  > Target todo item affected by this action when applicable. {@link
  > todoapp_todo_items.id}
- `action_type`
  > Categorical name of the administrative action (e.g., session.revoke,
  > account.suspend, content.remove).
- `scope`
  > Optional scope or context string (e.g., policy namespace, feature area,
  > or case identifier).
- `outcome`: Outcome of the action (e.g., success, failure, partial).
- `reason_text`
  > Free-form explanation complementing the structured justification when
  > provided.
- `ticket_reference`: External case/ticket identifier associated with the action, when present.
- `occurred_at`: UTC timestamp when the administrative action occurred (immutable).
- `created_at`: Record creation timestamp (storage time).
- `updated_at`: Record last update timestamp (metadata maintenance only).
- `deleted_at`: Soft deletion timestamp for retention control; null when active.

### `todoapp_access_justifications`

Catalog of access and action justification reasons used to authorize
elevated administrative operations. Includes unique code, human-readable
name, optional description/policy reference, and activation flag.
Provenance link to the admin curator is optional and uses
onDelete=SetNull to preserve catalog entries if the admin is removed.

Properties as follows:

- `id`: Primary Key.
- `todoapp_admin_id`
  > Administrator who created or last curated this justification entry (when
  > tracked). [todoapp_admins.id](#todoapp_admins)
- `code`: Unique business code for the justification (e.g., POL-USER-VERIFY).
- `name`: Human-readable name/title for the justification.
- `description`
  > Detailed description of when this justification applies and any
  > constraints.
- `policy_reference_uri`: Optional URI to internal policy documentation for this justification.
- `active`
  > Whether this justification is currently active and selectable for new
  > admin actions.
- `created_at`: Record creation timestamp.
- `updated_at`: Record last update timestamp.
- `deleted_at`: Soft deletion timestamp for retention control; null when active.

### `todoapp_legal_holds`

Records policy or legal holds that prevent purge or alteration of user
resources. A hold can be scoped to an entire account and/or to a specific
todo item. While active, retention and purge processes must defer
deletion of the affected records. Designed for auditability with explicit
imposed and release timestamps. Related entities: {@link
todoapp_accounts} and [todoapp_todo_items](#todoapp_todo_items).

Properties as follows:

- `id`: Primary Key.
- `todoapp_account_id`: Account under hold, referencing [todoapp_accounts.id](#todoapp_accounts).
- `todoapp_todo_item_id`: Specific todo item under hold, referencing [todoapp_todo_items.id](#todoapp_todo_items).
- `active`
  > Whether the hold is currently effective. Applications should ensure
  > exactly one active record per scope when required by policy.
- `reason_code`
  > Short machine-friendly code describing why the hold exists (e.g.,
  > legal_dispute, compliance_investigation).
- `note`: Optional human-readable explanation or additional context for the hold.
- `reference_uri`
  > Optional link to a policy document, case file, or external reference
  > associated with this hold.
- `imposed_at`: Timestamp when the hold was imposed. Used for audit and precedence.
- `released_at`
  > Timestamp when the hold was released, if applicable. Null means still
  > active until explicitly released.
- `created_at`: Record creation time for auditability.
- `updated_at`: Last update time for auditability.
- `deleted_at`: Soft deletion time, if the record is logically removed from active use.

### `todoapp_account_deletions`

Lifecycle controller for account deletions including request time,
scheduled deletion after grace, and eventual completion or cancellation.
Enforces least-privilege oversight by optionally linking to an admin
actor. Timestamps represent business state transitions without storing
derived status fields. Related entities: [todoapp_accounts](#todoapp_accounts)
(required), optional [todoapp_admins](#todoapp_admins).

Properties as follows:

- `id`: Primary Key.
- `todoapp_account_id`: Target account scheduled for deletion. [todoapp_accounts.id](#todoapp_accounts).
- `todoapp_admin_id`
  > Admin who initiated or confirmed the deletion, if applicable. {@link
  > todoapp_admins.id}.
- `requested_at`: When the deletion was requested.
- `scheduled_deletion_at`
  > When the account is scheduled to be permanently deleted after the grace
  > period.
- `canceled_at`
  > If the deletion was canceled during the grace period, the time of
  > cancellation.
- `completed_at`: When the permanent deletion completed, if applicable.
- `deletion_grace_days`
  > Grace window in days captured at the time of the request for audit (e.g.,
  > 14).
- `initiated_by_admin`
  > Whether the deletion request was initiated by an administrator (true) or
  > by the user (false).
- `requested_reason`
  > Optional free-text reason supplied at request time (user-provided or
  > administrative note).
- `created_at`: Record creation time for auditability.
- `updated_at`: Last update time for auditability.
- `deleted_at`: Soft deletion time, if the record is logically removed from active use.

### `todoapp_purge_queue_items`

Work queue entries for policy-driven permanent deletion of eligible
records across domains. Uses a generic target_table and target_id to
support heterogeneous resources under compliance governance. Includes
scheduling, prioritization, locking, retry metadata, and outcome
information to ensure reliable purge orchestration.

Properties as follows:

- `id`: Primary Key.
- `target_table`
  > Exact table name containing the record to purge (e.g.,
  > todoapp_todo_items, todoapp_export_artifacts).
- `target_id`: Primary key value of the target record to purge within target_table.
- `eligible_at`
  > When this record becomes eligible for purge (e.g., end of retention or
  > grace).
- `priority`
  > Relative processing priority; lower numbers may be treated as higher
  > priority depending on worker policy.
- `attempts`: Number of processing attempts performed so far for this queue item.
- `last_attempt_at`: Timestamp of the last processing attempt, if any.
- `locked_at`: Timestamp when a worker locked this item for processing.
- `locked_by`: Identifier for the worker/node that acquired the lock.
- `processed_at`: When the item finished processing (success or terminal failure).
- `success`
  > Whether the purge operation ultimately succeeded. Null until processing
  > completes.
- `error_code`: Optional short code describing the last failure reason, if any.
- `error_message`: Optional detailed error message for diagnostics; avoid sensitive data.
- `created_at`: Record creation time for auditability.
- `updated_at`: Last update time for auditability.
- `deleted_at`
  > Soft deletion time, if the queue entry is logically removed from active
  > use.
