### `todoapp_account_suspensions`

Account-level suspension records for policy enforcement and recovery.
Links to the affected account, optionally to the initiating admin and the
access justification. Stores immutable reason, start time, optional
review schedule, and lift time. No denormalized active flag; activity is
inferred by whether [todoapp_account_suspensions.lifted_at](#todoapp_account_suspensions) is
null. Supports investigative queries and auditability alongside {@link
todoapp_admin_action_logs} and [todoapp_access_justifications](#todoapp_access_justifications).

Properties as follows:

- `id`: Primary Key.
- `todoapp_account_id`: Affected account's [todoapp_accounts.id](#todoapp_accounts).
- `initiated_by_admin_id`
  > Initiating administrator's [todoapp_admins.id](#todoapp_admins). Nullable for
  > system-initiated suspensions or automated policy actions.
- `access_justification_id`
  > Business justification record's [todoapp_access_justifications.id](#todoapp_access_justifications)
  > documenting why the action was taken.
- `reason`
  > Human-readable reason for suspension (policy code, case link, or
  > narrative summary).
- `suspended_at`: Timestamp when the suspension took effect.
- `review_at`
  > Optional timestamp suggesting when to review the suspension for
  > continuation or lift.
- `lifted_at`: Timestamp when the suspension was lifted. Null if still in effect.
- `suspension_type`
  > Categorization of suspension scope (e.g., write-only, full). Free-form
  > string for policy evolution; not an enum at DB level.
- `created_at`: Creation timestamp for this record.
- `updated_at`: Last update timestamp for this record.
- `deleted_at`: Soft deletion timestamp; null means active.

### `todoapp_rate_limit_incidents`

Signals and records of rate limit incidents for abuse detection, user
guidance, and tuning. Optionally associates with an account and session
if known, while allowing anonymous actors via IP attribution. Captures
action category, observed counts versus threshold, and whether the action
was blocked. Complements monitoring and audit without storing sensitive
secrets.

Properties as follows:

- `id`: Primary Key.
- `todoapp_account_id`
  > Associated account's [todoapp_accounts.id](#todoapp_accounts), if the actor is
  > authenticated.
- `todoapp_session_id`: Associated session's [todoapp_sessions.id](#todoapp_sessions), if available.
- `action`
  > Normalized action/category identifier at business level (e.g., write,
  > read, login, export).
- `window_start`
  > Start time of the rolling window used by the limiter when evaluating this
  > incident.
- `window_end`
  > End time of the rolling window used by the limiter when evaluating this
  > incident.
- `observed_count`: Number of actions observed within the window.
- `limit_threshold`
  > Allowed maximum actions for the evaluated window at the time of the
  > incident.
- `blocked`: Whether the limiter blocked the action(s) at the time of this incident.
- `ip`
  > Actor source IP in textual form (IPv4/IPv6). May be empty if unavailable
  > or redacted by policy.
- `user_agent`
  > User-Agent string captured for investigative purposes. May be truncated
  > per policy.
- `created_at`: Creation timestamp for this record.
- `updated_at`: Last update timestamp for this record.
- `deleted_at`: Soft deletion timestamp; null means active.

### `todoapp_security_events`

General security event ledger capturing notable occurrences (e.g.,
authentication successes/failures, session revocations, admin support
actions). Stores immutable event type, severity, occurrence time,
optional actor/target context, and brief message for investigation. Links
to accounts, sessions, admins, and access justifications where
applicable. Complements [todoapp_audit_logs](#todoapp_audit_logs) while focusing on
security signals and detection needs.

Properties as follows:

- `id`: Primary Key.
- `todoapp_account_id`: Associated account's [todoapp_accounts.id](#todoapp_accounts), if any.
- `todoapp_session_id`: Associated session's [todoapp_sessions.id](#todoapp_sessions), if any.
- `todoapp_admin_id`
  > Associated administrator's [todoapp_admins.id](#todoapp_admins), when the actor is
  > an admin.
- `access_justification_id`
  > Access justification's [todoapp_access_justifications.id](#todoapp_access_justifications) for
  > privileged actions requiring documented reason.
- `event_type`
  > Business-level event type key (e.g., auth.login.success,
  > auth.login.failure, session.revoked, admin.support.view).
- `severity`
  > Event severity classification (e.g., low, medium, high, critical).
  > Free-form string for policy evolution.
- `occurred_at`
  > Timestamp when the underlying event actually occurred (may differ from
  > record creation time).
- `source_ip`
  > Source IP address (IPv4/IPv6 textual). May be null if unavailable or
  > redacted by policy.
- `user_agent`: User-Agent string for investigative context. May be truncated per policy.
- `target_resource_id`
  > Optional UUID of the resource involved (generic target; not a foreign key
  > to maintain independence).
- `message`: Short human-readable message or context snippet without sensitive secrets.
- `created_at`: Creation timestamp for this record.
- `updated_at`: Last update timestamp for this record.
- `deleted_at`: Soft deletion timestamp; null means active.
